name: PHILLY CHEESESTEAKS WITH MELTED FONTINA
description: Philly's signature sandwich is always a sure-fire hit. Try this version with sauteed red onion and melted fontina in place of the signature "whiz."

name: NORTH CAROLINA PULLED PORK BBQ SANDWICH
description: North Carolinians are proud of their vinegar-based pulled pork (the tangier, the better!). Our perfectly tuned barbecue sauce has sugar and honey for balancing sweetness, crushed red pepper for some heat and a whole cup of cider vinegar.

name: CAJUN SHRIMP PO' BOYS
description: Get a taste of Louisiana with Kelsey's fried shrimp sandwich dusted with spicy Creole seasoning like good ol' po' boys.

name: DILLY PICKLED EGG SALAD SANDWICH
description: Gently simmer slightly older eggs and then peel them while they are still warm; this will yield tender, perfectly cooked eggs. Mix the mashed yolks, mayo and mustard with relish, dill, shallots and lemon zest for an egg salad with flavor and bite

name: BRISKET SANDWICH
description: This isn't just a brisket sandwich — it's THE brisket sandwich. Chuck coats his brisket with a homemade dry rub before baking it for several hours and topping it off with his very own apple barbecue sauce.

name: SMOKEY TURKEY AND SPINACH MEATBALL SUBS
description: Serve these meatballs over your favorite pasta one night and on a crispy bagette the next day for a satisfyingly saucy lunch.

name: COBB SALAD PANINI
description: Greens might not seem like your best between-bread filling, but this meaty salad sandwich is anything but wimpy.

name: CRISPY TUNA-CAKE SLIDERS WITH CITRUS SLAW
description: These crowd-pleasing sliders have the consistency of a crab cake but are made with canned tuna so they cost just a fraction of the price to create.

name: EGG WHITE, ONION + FIG JAM SANDWICH
description: A wicked sandwich that's easy on your taste buds and your figure. Homemade fig jam and caramelized onions provide so much sweet flavor that you won't miss the yolks in this recipe one little bit.

name: MUSTARD GLAZED BAKED HAM AND PIMENTO CHEESE BISCUITS
description: Bobby Flay's made-from-scratch buttermilk biscuits help take his sandwich to new, buttery heights. If you're pressed for time, however, store-bought biscuits or biscuit mix will work just fine too.

name: PULLED PORK AND KIMCHI SANDWICH
description: Chuck Hughes' tender smoked pulled pork and kimchi sandwich, served with a sweet and tangy glaze, is an international take on the classic barbecue dish.

name: CARRIBEAN WRAP
description: Spicy and sweet, this tropical wrap is packed with lean, tasty and nutritious fillings like black beans, chicken breast, mango and macadamia nuts.

name: BEN SARGENT'S LOBSTER ROLL
description: Ben Sargent's buttery lobster roll is unadorned — no seasonings, no celery — and his once top-secret recipe nails the seaside sandwich on the head

name: GRILLED CHEESE SANDWICH
description: Grill Kelsey's combo of apple, bacon, mustard and cheddar for the perfect salty-sweet grilled cheese sandwich.

name: KENTUCKY HOT BROWN
description: The Hot Brown — an open-faced turkey sandwich topped with bacon and Mornay sauce and then baked until the bread is crispy and the cheesy sauce browns — hails from a hotel in Kentucky.

name: GRILLED VEGETABLE PANINI WITH HERBED FETA SPREAD
description: The salty, herby feta spread, made thick, creamy and tangy with cream cheese and sour cream, almost overshadows all the fresh veggies in this sandwich

name: OPEN-FACED SAUSAGE, 3 PEPPER AND ONION SANDWICHES
description: Rachael piles these Italian-style sandwiches high with sausage, red sauce and veggies. She uses leftover sauce from her braciole, but it takes just a little more time to start from scratch

name: TALEGGIO AND PEAR PANINI
description: This sandwich, oozing with decadent Taleggio cheese, might seem gourmet but is still easy to prepare and eat

name: AVOCADO, ROAST TURKEY AND BACON
description: Tyler roasts his own turkey for this ultimate turkey sandwich, but if short on time you could use deli meat. The kicker is the herbed butter that he uses to cook the turkey and slather on the sandwich bread.

name: CAPRESE SANDWICHES WITH BASIL OIL
description: With a simple sandwich like the caprese, it's all about the quality, not the quantity, of ingredients; make sure you pick firm tomatoes and the freshest mozzarella and basil available

name: THE ULTIMATE STEAK SANDWICH
description: Tyler takes the steak sandwich to a whole new level by jazzing it up with condiments like arugula mayo and Gruyere bechamel.

name: SKIRT STEAK QUESADILLAS
description: These quesadillas — the Mexican equivalent of a sandwich, in our opinion — are amped up with tomatillo guacamole, made from those tart, still-green tomatoes

name: THREE-MINUTE STEAK HOAGIES
description: Leave it to Rachael Ray to serve up juicy sandwiches with homemade steak sauce in less than five minutes.

name: DUCK SANDWICH WITH MANGO CHUTNEY
description: A sweet chutney is the condiment of choice in India, and in Roger's recipe it helps to balance the deeply savory flavor of the duck meat.

name: OPEN-FACED CREAMED CHICKEN SANDWICH
description: Served hot, this chicken salad tastes like a sandwich version of chicken pot pie. The creamed chicken can be covered and refrigerated for a make-ahead meal. Reheat over medium heat, partially covered.

name: BBQ BRISKET REUBEN
description: Two Jewish favorites — tender brisket and the Reuben sandwich — combine in this over-the-top sandwich that's perfect for any-time-of-day indulgence.

name: MEDITERRANEAN SALMON SANDWICH
description: Two tips to make this salmon sandwich extraordinary: It's best if you make the salmon filling ahead of time to really let the flavors combine, and use an herbed Italian bread for extra flavor if you can find a loaf.

name: HUNGRY GRILLED GRACELAND SPECIAL
description: Elvis is known to have loved toasted PB sandwiches with bananas. One bite of this sweet sandwich and you'll understand why.
